commit_list.message:
Support user message to check macros.

They design is trick and sacrifices understandability of codes.
- Add a new class, StringCache, to store user message
- Return value of StringCache::operator<<(const char*) is bool, so
  that it can be used as rvalue of an assignment statement
- Change return value of checking helper functions to bool&, so it can
  be used as lvalue of an assignment statement
- Add a local static bool variable to checking helper functions so
  that they can return bool&
- Use assignment statement to ensure StringCache is set before running
  checking help functions
